headline: How To Make the Best, Easiest Homemade Alfredo Sauce
description: A dose of dairy is the secret to 5-ingredient, everyday Alfredo sauce.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups freshly grated Parmesan cheese (2 1/2 ounces)

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter and sauté the garlic. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté until fragrant and lightly browned, 30 seconds to 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Heat the heavy cream. Whisk the heavy cream into the butter until combined. Heat, whisking occasionally, until the cream simmers, 3 to 4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Whisk in the Parmesan cheese and seasonings. Whisk in the Parmesan cheese, salt, nutmeg, and pepper.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Cook until the sauce thickens. Cook, whisking occasionally, until the sauce thickens to coat the back of a spoon, 3 to 4 minutes. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed, then serve immediately.

HowtoTip.text: Storage: The sauce is best served immediately. Refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container, and add a splash of milk before reheating over low heat on the stovetop.

video.name: Easiest Homemade Alfredo Sauce
video.description: Here is the foolproof way to make Alfredo sauce at home. The silky texture of authentic Alfredo sauce develops from a balanced emulsion of grated Parmesan, butter, and starchy pasta water. But when mealtime calls for serving a garlicky Parmesan cream sauce without pasta (or its cooking liquid!) on the side, you need a new approach. Don't tell my Italian in-laws, but a dose of dairy is the secret to my 5-ingredient, everyday Alfredo sauce.
